comments:
I downloaded the wtp-all-in-one-sdk-1.0-win32.zip file and re-installed it.
I used the same workspace folder that I was previously using too...
(I mention this.. because I am worried that there is some "crap"
left from a previous install that is confusing ECLIPSE ...)

I was following the directions to install the JBOSS ide in
http://www.devx.com/opensource/Article/20242 (JBoss Meets the Eclipse: Introducing the Jboss IDE).

I successfully installed the JBOSS-IDE software updates using that article.
I also successfully performed the "customize perspective" step.
But I ran into trouble doing the "Configuring and Launching a Server" step.

When I tried to do "run->debug" and create a new configuration under "Jboss 4.0.x" a dialog box opened saying "An error has occured. Please see the error log for details".

The failed JBoss 4.0.x configuration says "New configuration"...

Incidently once before I *had* created a 4.0.2 configuration, and I can
see that old name (from a prior eclipse installation), but when I click
on the 4.0.2 configuration, it also displays the message "an error has
occured. Please see the error log file."

By the way it would be nicer if the error message said see the
<WORKSPACE>/.metadata/.log file, or "click here to open the log file".
I had to do a google FAQ search to find the location of the .log file.

I tracked down the .log file in <workspace>/.metadata/  and here it is:

Is this a bug for the WTP project?

The error is coming from the JBoss IDE, not WTP or Eclipse. It looks like the JBoss IDE was built for a different version of Eclipse and is using internal references that are no longer valid. You'll need to open this defect against wherever you got the JBoss IDE from (it is not an Eclipse.org project).

FYI, if you just want regular JBoss support it is already available in WTP without the JBoss IDE. Just follow one of the WTP tutorials or create a new JBoss server.
